items.title: Google hit with $3.45 billion EU antitrust fine over adtech practices
items.description: The latest fine compared with a record 4.3 billion euro penalty handed out to Google in 2018, 2.42 billion euros in 2017 and a 1.49 billion euros in 2019

items.title: Tata Motors to cut car, SUV prices sharply after GST reduction; popular model to get cheaper by Rs 1.55 lakh
items.description: Tata Motors SUVs such as the Harrier and Safari will see price cuts of up to Rs 1.40 lakh and Rs 1.45 lakh, respectively, while the Curvv will become cheaper by up to Rs 65,000.

items.title: Vedanta beats Adani Group with Rs 17,000 crore bid to acquire Jaiprakash Associates
items.description: Lenders of JAL conducted a challenge process for the sale of the company under the IBC

items.title: Oreo maker Mondelez flags slowdown in India's biscuit consumption
items.description: Oreo, introduced by the Cadbury maker in 2011, was positioned in the premium biscuits category but launched with an aggressive entry price of Rs 10 a pack, making it accessible to most Indian households.

items.title: BHEL to develop fuel cell-based trains in partnership with Singapore-based Horizon Tech
items.description: A hydrogen fuel cell-based rolling stock uses on-board hydrogen fuel cells to generate electricity, and is a zero-emission alternative to diesel or electric trains.

items.title: Tesla offers unprecedented $1 trillion pay package to Elon Musk
items.description: The plan dangles a financial windfall and expanded control of the company to Musk, already the world’s richest person, after his 2018 package valued in excess of $50 billion was struck down by a Delaware court

items.title: Mining major GMDC shares near record high with heavy volumes on Centre's rare earth focus
items.description: The company has been in focus of late with the Centre planning a concerted push towards rare earth mining to secure supplies, as well as the company's stated plans to foray into new mining ventures.

items.title: Glenmark shares rally over 2.5 percent on muti-nation Phase 3 trial for cancer drug Envafolimab
items.description: An exchange filing by Glenmark said that it has received approval from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) to commence patient enrollment and dosing in India.

items.title: Is the fertiliser sector becoming investment worthy?
items.description: The latest GST reforms address the key issue of the inverted duty structure

items.title: What to expect from Indian equities, post GST 2.0?
items.description: It is unlikely to be a one-way street, given the conflicting forces at work

items.title: Weekly Tactical Pick: Why this industrial capex play offers value
items.description: Weekly tactical: why this industrial capex play offers value

items.title: Waaree makes an opportune investment in Kotsons
items.description: Kotsons will help Waaree provide integrated solutions and diversify its revenue mix

items.title: Lenders of bankrupt Jaiprakash Associates to meet Friday; challenge process among 5 bidders likely
items.description: The Committee of Creditors (CoC) meeting is scheduled on September 5. Adani Group, Dalmia Bharat, Vedanta Group, Jindal Power and PNC Infratech have submitted bids to acquire JAL.

items.title: GST rationalisation a big booster to consumption-driven growth: Mukesh Ambani
items.description: The Ambanis said the GST overhaul will not only strengthen consumer confidence but also create opportunities across the retail value chain — from farmers and MSMEs to producers, suppliers, kiranas and end-consumers.

items.title: Bata begins giving GST rationalisation benefits to customers
items.description: Under the scheme, prices across Bata outlets reflect a 7 per cent reduction, with the company absorbing the differential to pass on immediate savings to buyers, the company said in a statement.Footwear has seen GST cut from 12 per cent to 5 per cent.

items.title: Mizuho’s Avendus deal in India is said to stall on valuation
items.description: Mizuho was on the verge of buying a majority stake in Avendus in what would be the latest acquisition by a Japanese bank in India, people familiar with the matter said in June

items.title: TBO Tek: Expanding into the US luxury travel market
items.description: Move strengthens luxury travel offerings and marks TBO’s entry into the North American premium outbound market

items.title: Footwear and Apparel – will GST provide a fillip for the organised sector?
items.description: While the overall impact of GST rate rationalisation on footwear is positive, the same may not be true for the apparel industry

items.title: GST cut to benefit consumer-ware, QSR
items.description: GST rate cut on consumer ware categories, inputs of quick service restaurants would spur the demand

items.title: Which insurance players will be impacted most and least by GST exemptions?
items.description: The move will lower insurance premiums for policyholders and prospective buyers, encourage greater insurance penetration, and provide a significant boost to the industry

items.title: GST boost for FMCG companies to drive demand recovery, sector re-rating
items.description: Lower taxes on daily essentials, packaged food, and oral and personal care categories will revive consumption

items.title: Cement companies to benefit from GST rate cut, favourable cost outlook
items.description: Lower tax on cement and stable production costs should benefit cement companies. However, does it change the investment outlook for cement majors?

items.title: GST rate cuts to benefit players across the healthcare sector
items.description: Rates have been pruned for drugs used in chronic diseases as also medical devices and hospital chains

items.title: Which auto stocks stand to gain most from the GST reset?
items.description: A reduction in the GST rate from 28 percent to 18 percent for most automobile sub-segments is expected to boost overall sales. But a few will gain more than the others

items.title: GST rate cuts to boost urban consumption, give formal sector a leg-up
items.description: The overall verdict is that it is certainly positive for urban consumption, particularly in the mass consumption categories, where stress has been most visible
